means: <正，贬>慷慨激昂的演说，雄辩 （术）

sentence.Network_en: Declamation is a traditional Chinese teaching method.
sentence.Network_cn: 诵读教学是我国传统的语文教学方法。

sentence.Network_en: I see that I have lapsed into parable and ecstatic declamation.
sentence.Network_cn: 我知道我在比喻和狂喜的辩论中造成了遗误.

sentence.Network_en: Were you present at the declamation contest of Freshmen?
sentence.Network_cn: 大一的朗诵比赛你参加了没有?

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'a set speech'): from Latin declamatio(n-), from the verb declamare (see declaim)

means.word_mean: 2. recitation of a speech from memory with studied gestures and intonation as an exercise in elocution or rhetoric

auth_sentence.content: But Singaporean drama needs fewer symbols and stronger characters, less declamation and more exploration.
